newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech IPB sees CZK 2.031 bln 1997 net.
newsitem.headline: Czech IPB sees CZK 2.031 bln 1997 net.

text.p: The Czech bank IPB a.s., one of the country's four largest, said on Thursday that it expected 1997 after-tax profit to rise to 2.031 billion crowns, under Czech accounting standards, from 858 million in 1996.
"The business plan approved for 1997 expects, in part, net profit of 2.031 billion crowns," a statement by the bank's spokesman said.
The business plan was approved by bank's annual general meeting on Thursday which also approved an eight crown per share gross dividend on 1996 profit.
The bank said it expected an increase in total credit granted of 8.5 percent this year, with an 11 percent increase in primary deposits.
